steps: Preheat your oven to ['temp']{220}. Butter the ramekins and dust them with a little cocoa powder, tapping out the excess.
In a microwave-safe bowl or saucepan, melt the ['ing']{Unsalted butter} and ['ing']{Dark chocolate}. Let it cool slightly.
Mix wet ingredients. In a medium bowl, whisk together the ['ing']{Granulated sugar}, ['ing']{Medium eggs}, and ['ing']{Vanilla extract} until light and fluffy.
Slowly pour the melted chocolate and butter into the egg mixture, whisking constantly until smooth.
Gently fold in the ['ing']{All-purpose flour} and salt until just combined. Do not overmix.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared ramekins, filling them about 3/4 full.
Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes. The edges should be set, but the center should still be soft and jiggly.
Let the cakes cool for 1-2 minutes, then run a knife around the edges to loosen them.
